snippet: A judge in Virginia has dismissed drunken driving charges against J. Randolph Babbitt, who resigned as administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration after being arrested in December.
abstract: Virginia Judge Ian M O'Flaherty clears J Randolph Babbitt, former chief of the Federal Aviation Administration, of the drunken driving charges that cost him his job at agency.
lead_paragraph: A judge in Virginia has dismissed drunken driving charges against J. Randolph Babbitt, who resigned as administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration after being arrested in December.

headline.seo: Former F.A.A. Chief Cleared of Drunken Driving Charges
headline.main: F.A.A. Chief Who Quit Is Cleared of Charges
headline.print_headline: F.A.A. Chief Who Quit Is Cleared Of Charges
